page.title: 15A TYPICAL SUNDAY (cont.)
page.content: AFTER TWO OCLOCK GROUPS OF CHILDREN APPEAR ON TO THE STREETS.SOME PLAY WITH THEIR BY BICYCLE AND OTHERS WITH BALLS AND OTHERS PERHAPS WITH THEIR DOGS OR AT THE SWINGS.A FEW MAY BE SEEN WITH THEIR FISHING RODS ON THEIR WAY TO OUR FAMOUS RIVER.HERE AND THERE BIG PEOPLE CHAT OR SIT READING THE SUNDAY PAPERS THEY BOUGHT EARLY THAT MORNING.AT 3pm PEOPLE GO TO THE SERVICE IN THE CHURCH OF IRELAND. SOON CARS AND PEOPLE HEAD FOR THE SPORTS FIELD,MIDDLETOWN EOGHAN RUADHS FOOTBALL TEAM MAY BE PLAYING IN THE LEAGUE.SO CHEERS AND SHOUTS MAY BE HEARD EVEN IN THE VILLAGE. SOON SUNDAY EVENING DRAWS TO AN END,PEOPLE COME HOME AFTER VISITING RELATIVES AND VARIOUS OTHER PLACES TO GO TO BED AFTER A BUSY SUNDAY IN THE SMALL VILLAGE OF MIDDLETOWN.
